Sounds like it does...then you'd have a CardFactory
(CardCreator, Dealer, whatever) for the creation test,
then the test for the Card itself. :)

-Eric

--- Robert Wenner <robert@...> wrote:
> On Thursday 04 July 2002 14:05, Eric Heikkila wrote:
> > Call it what it is.  If it's testing transfering
> > money, call it TransferMoneyFromAccountTest or
> > something.  Our usual convention, however, is to
> > simply call it the name of the class we are
> testing
> > with Test at the end.  So if you are really
> testing
> > the AccountTransfer class then just call it
> > AccountTransferTest.
> >
> > -Eric
> 
> I have a class Card without constructors but lots of
> factory methods 
> that create special instances, i.e. to create only
> the "allowed"Cards.
> 
> To seperate the tests and keep them smaller I made
> two test classes for 
> this Card, named CardCreationTest and
> CardInternalTest.
> CardCreationTest calls each factory method and
> checks whether the 
> returned card is as expected.
> CardInternalsTest (maybe a misnomer) tests the
> "regular" methods in 
> Card.
> 
> Maybe this test class names indicate the factory
> methods want to be in 
> a factory class of their own.
> 
> Robert
>
